apis.description: Add notifications for a particular user

operations.summary: Pushes new notifications that are attached to a specified user
operations.notes: Uploads notifications to the database. Data should be a JSON array of entries. On call, returns a string, named result, with the value 'SUCCESS' on success and 'ERROR' otherwise. If the value is 'ERROR', information about the error follows. Requires authentication via OAuth, to an account that has some sort of permission.

parameters.name: notifications
parameters.description: json formatted array of book_ping entries.

operations.notes: Retrieves a list of the most recent notifications, which it returns as a json array called notifications. By default, returns the 20 most recent. Search can be limited using the optional parameters: Will return the 20 most recent pings that match all parameters. Also returns a string named result which will be 'SUCCESS' if everything worked. If not, it will be 'ERROR' followed by an explanatory message. Requires authentication via OAuth, to an account that has "read inventory" permission.

parameters.name: book_tag
parameters.description: Base-64 representation of the book tag. Example: 00bQu5M2JJDVmHB7__OM00040

parameters.name: call_number
parameters.description: Call number, in human-readable format. Example: NX543 .c38 2000

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Return only pings that come on or after this date. "0000-00-00 00:00:00" format.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Return only pings that come before this date. "0000-00-00 00:00:00" format.

parameters.name: num_limit
parameters.description: Number of items to return, between 1 and 1000. Default is 20.
